For more information, please refer to our [contributor's guide](https://oss-generic.github.io/process/).
> "Do not go gentle into that good night. Old age should burn and rave at close of ay. Rage, rage against the dying of
KIPP is an AI Assistant, named after one of the robots from the movie Interstellar. In the movie, KIPP detonates itself
when interacted with. This repository is based on the provided project template for a greenfield Java project. Given
below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.
1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/kipp.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run kipp.main()` (if the code
editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the
**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move
Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle)
- Github Copilot was used as an auto-complete tool throughout this project.

* Represents a command that can be executed by the user.

* The function that will be called to generate a response when the command is requested.
* Constructor for Command class, used to create a new command without arguments.

* @param description     A brief description of what the command will do.
* @param commandFunction The function that will be called when the command is executed.
private Command(String command, String description, CommandFunction commandFunction) {
* Constructor for Command class, used to create a new command with arguments.
* @param command         The command that will uniquely identify this command.

* @param commandFunction The function that will be called when the command is executed.

* Factory method to create a new command with arguments.

* @param description     A brief description of what the command will do.
* @param commandFunction The function that will be called when the command is executed.
public static Command createCommandWithArgs(String command, String exampleArgs,
return new Command(command, exampleArgs, description, commandFunction);

: "Error message must be present and non-empty for non-successful command results.";

* Checks if the command result is successful.

* Checks if the command result is an unexpected error.
* @return True if the command result is an unexpected error, false otherwise.
